snippet: Justice Scalia, whose legal theories, vivid writing and outsize personality made him a conservative leader, was found dead on Saturday in Texas.
abstract: Justice Antonin Scalia, who served three decades in Supreme Court and who rose to prominence on strength of outsize personality, vivid writing and transformative legal theories, dies at age 79; began time in court as outsider and eventually became remarkably influential justice known for adherence to concept of originalism, which seeks to interpret Constitution as it was understood at time of its adoption.
lead_paragraph: Justice Scalia, whose legal theories, vivid writing and outsize personality made him a conservative leader, was found dead on Saturday in Texas.

headline.main: Antonin Scalia, Justice on the Supreme Court, Dies at 79
headline.print_headline: Justice Scalia, Who Led Court’s Conservative Renaissance, Dies At 79
